boardgame.name: Delta World Core Guidebook (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

SURVIVE AND THRIVE IN A POST-APOCALYPTIC WORLD OF MUTANTS, ANDROIDS, CYBORGS, ROBOTS, AND HIGH TECHNOLOGY!

Delta World is a wild and sparsely populated future Earth. It is 150 years after The Great Catastrophe, an apocalyptic global war that resulted in the complete destruction of civilized society. The environmental contamination from chemical, biological and radiological warfare has resulted in a world of mutated beings: animals, humanoids, plants, and others.

Now, finally, the small communities of intelligent beings that have survived are beginning to claw their way back from the depths of technological ignorance. Their numbers are expanding, and they strive to create new civilizations once again. You are one of these intelligent beings. You live in a world that has been reclaimed by nature, where overgrown ruins can be exploited for the vast technology once mastered by the Ancient Ones. With luck, you and your companions can find these ancient ruins and scavenge the materials, equipment, and technology that you need to continue to advance. But the world is dangerous, unexplored, and treacherous. Can you survive?

Compatible with the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game First Edition and the Open Game License 3.5 system rules, Delta World creates a post-apocalyptic, science fantasy expansion with a crisp gameplay experience and an old-school RPG feel.

The Delta World 5E Core Guidebook includes:
• All player and game master rules in a single volume.
• Complete rules for mutated and engineered character races, including mutated humanoids, mutated animals, mutated plants, androids, sentient robots, and cyborgs.
• Expanded rules for mutations, cybernetic implants, and technological augmentations.
• New feats, skills, equipment, and gear suitable for the post-apocalyptic science fantasy setting.
• Enhanced rules and gaming aids for sandbox exploration.
• Expanded rules for interacting with, repairing, and salvaging valuable materials from technological items.
• New gaming aids for playing Delta World in a virtual tabletop environment, including rollable tables and high-quality pre-generated maps.

boardgame.name: The Base 16 Enigma Player's Guide (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

So…What Was That, Again?

Sometimes, a little help is needed to survive the challenges of Delta World! This Player’s Guide has been compiled to aid you, the player, in the development of your character to meet the challenges you will face in the three-part adventure campaign, The Base 16 Enigma.

What skills and feats are best suited? What information does my character need to succeed? Who was that technological salvage expert?

Answers to these questions, and more, can be found within the pages of this Player’s Guide. Intended to supplement the information found in the Delta World Core Guidebook and Open Game License sources, it provides an invaluable reference for developing your character and starting out in this campaign.

boardgame.name: The Base 16 Enigma Part 1: The Enigma Signal (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Technological Module LW-01: The Enigma Signal

The year is 2471. A group of scavengers operating in the remote wilderness has picked up a weak, repeating radio signal. Before they can identify the source of the transmission, the signal ceases. From Base 16, their remote outpost, they dispatch a request for additional support and transmit a replicate signal back to their home base for analysis. When the signal is received, a long dormant computer system sputters to life. Whoever, or whatever, sent that signal must be connected with the Ancient Ones!

Attempts to contact the scavengers have failed. Now, its up to you and your companions to find out what has happened at the remote Base 16 outpost, and what this mysterious signal may mean for the inhabitants of Delta World!

boardgame.name: The Base 16 Enigma Part 1: The Enigma Signal (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Technological Module LW-01: The Enigma Signal

The year is 2471. A group of scavengers operating in the remote wilderness has picked up a weak, repeating radio signal. Before they can identify the source of the transmission, the signal ceases. From Base 16, their remote outpost, they dispatch a request for additional support and transmit a replicate signal back to their home base for analysis. When the signal is received, a long dormant computer system sputters to life. Whoever, or whatever, sent that signal must be connected with the Ancient Ones!

Attempts to contact the scavengers have failed. Now, its up to you and your companions to find out what has happened at the remote Base 16 outpost, and what this mysterious signal may mean for the inhabitants of Delta World!

boardgame.name: The Fomorian
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Good, the Bad, and the Fomorian!

Welcome to the cinematic, rules-lite Everywhen system, a universal RPG powered by the Barbarians of Lemuria engine. The Fomorian is a quickstart solo adventure, set against a space western backdrop. You play as Seamus Rann, an intergalactic bounty hunter, as she tracks her quarry on an alien world. By the time you finish, you’ll know all the basics of this “eminently hackable” ruleset. Time to bring your own genre mashup to life!

boardgame.name: Carrier Command 2
boardgame.description:
Carrier Command 2 is a real-time strategy game that puts you in command of a futuristic carrier able to launch a vast array of aircraft and amphibious units. Compete against AI or human players and hop into every single vehicle to take matters into your own hands!

Carrier Command 2 is Strategy, Planning, and Teamwork on a scale that is both engaging and manageable. True to MicroProse's heritage, Carrier Command 2 is all about meaningful decisions.

Strategize: Gather intel from your vehicles’ radars, pick your tools of the trade, and launch your attacks where the enemy presence is thinner. The approach you take to a situation will play a big part in the outcome.

Plan: Once you have taken an island you will need to exploit and defend the resources it provides. Ensuring these supply lines remain open will be key to your survival. Think ahead.

Teamwork: Make the most of different unit types synergies and create combined arms assaults to efficiently win battles. On top of that, get into each and every vehicle and take part in the action. Lead from the front!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Pulse-Pounding Pulp!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From globe-hopping tomb raids to gritty noir tales, masked vigilantes to occult detectives, PULSE-POUNDING PULP! delivers all the frantic action of the Dirty 30’s. Utilizing the rules-lite, cinematic Everywhen system (based on Simon Washbourne’s Barbarians of Lemuria), this setting book contains 41 new Boons and Flaws, 24 careers, and 6 fully realized adventures, as well as rules for weird science, psychic powers, vehicles, creatures, equipment, genre tweaks, and creating pulp heroes. 179 pages.

Adventures included:

+ Bring ‘em back alive—an Allosaurus, that is, from a lost world where titans still walk (Return to Dinosaur Island).

+ Quest for Incan gold in a mountain deathtrap, constructed for greedy conquistadors (Vault of the Condor).

+ Seek eternal youth among the jungles of Southeast Asia, braving temples infested with flesh-eating monkeys (The Devil’s Wat).

+ Discover the fate of the world’s greatest crime fighter, by exploring his secret lair (The Demise of Doctor Enigma).

+ Investigate devilish doings in a sin-drenched, supernatural Tinsel Town (Hooray for Hellwood).

+ Survive a “pleasure” voyage on an ocean liner overrun with lethal snakes (Serpent’s Cruise).

boardgame.name: The Galactic Primer on Urban Sprawls
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As species spread across the Nacora Galaxy, they develop settlements, cities, and unique cultural experiences. The Kygoran-Glabrau Conglomerate has carefully catalogued the many and varied facets of metropolitan living and all things technological in the Galactic Primer on Urban Sprawls for Spaceships and Starwyrms, a comprehensive 5th edition based game that brings science fiction and fantasy to the table. This is the second expansion for the S&S game system, expanding on the Core Sourcebook and Galactic Primer on Natural Environments.

The expansion includes:

14 new class archetypes
5 new backgrounds
New equipment (including magical cyberware) and vehicles
Rules for upgrading or modifying your spaceship beyond the norm
Over a hundred pages of magic items
20 mythic artifacts to use as the cornerstone of any campaign
New monsters
Rules for creating NPCs and locations


The Galactic Primer on Urban Sprawls has everything you need to take your S&S games to the next level!

boardgame.name: Stop the Robots
boardgame.description:
The chief of the special unit is calling you on a walkie-talkie: "We have a massive problem! A mad scientist has dumped crazy robots in the city! You are the only ones who can stop this threat. I will connect you with your partner on site in a moment. Together you have to deactivate the robots. Hurry up! Time is running out!"

In Stop the Robots, you must communicate with your partner on site to look through the robot cards and figure out which robot you are dealing with. Solve the tricky puzzles and tell your partner which wires to cut in order to deactivate the robot!

listing.notes: FRENCH EDITION

boardgame.name: Beneath a Stony Stump
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Beneath a Stony Stump is a puzzle-solving adventure inspired by old-school funhouse dungeons.

From the module:

Within the Spine of the World is a flat-topped mountain: the Stony Stump. The fortress within is a den of traps and treasure, curses and creatures, puzzles and perils. Many enter to steal its treasures; some return to put them back.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
...
DC Seed: I’d Like to Make a Return, Please.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: The Taming of the Chwinga
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A merchant from a prominent family needs your help getting rid of his bad luck, and the cursed artifact that has caused it. Will you undo the curse in time for him to avoid his demise, and for you to catch a rare performance at the local theater?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: What Stalks the Night?
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DC-POA-PND-5 What Stalks the Night?
(Fourth and Final Part of the Strange Case of Erland Forsk)

Many residents of Easthaven were woken in the early morning by an explosion. One of the houses near the Wet Trout tavern exploded, and a trail of large, webbed footprints were left in the snow leading off into the wilderness.

Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8

Using the DungeonCraft seed My, What Big Feet You Have
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures
The Strange Case of Erland Forsk

boardgame.name: Eateat Go Home?
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DC-POA-PND-4 Eateat Go Home?
(Part 3 of the Strange Case of Erland Forsk)

A small girl confides in you that she found a secret friend, and that she needs your help in getting him home. Will you be able to keep him safe while mysterious agents search for him?

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

Using the DungeonCraft seed The Littlest Squidling
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures
The Strange Case of Erland Forsk

boardgame.name: Iggy's Folly
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Zardak’s Ziggurat Presents:

DC-POA-Z-T2S2 Iggy’s Folly

Chardalyn Shenanigans

Find the intrepid adventurer Iggy Snoozenews and unravel the mystery surrounding the increase in chardalyn formations throughout Icewind Dale

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 7.

This adventure uses the ‘My, What Big Feet You Have’ DungeonCraft Story Seed.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Fabula Rasa: Crime
Histoires 100 fins: Edition Crime
boardgame.description:
In Fabula Rasa, players take turns telling a constantly changing story as is typical of oral traditions. The motifs on the cards provide visual bullet points for people, objects, and locations that are central to the action, things that must be remembered in the correct order, with cards disappearing and new ones being added each round. Those who, as a narrator, manage to present their version of the story without errors will be rewarded accordingly.

In Fabula Rasa: Crime, players slip into the role of lawyers who — despite confusing descriptions and unclear, changing evidence — have to give the most convincing explanation possible for the crime committed.

boardgame.name: The Forsaken Brewery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a DungeonCraft Adventure legal, Season 10 Adventurers League play in Good Mead, Icewind Dale.
Help the inhabitants of Good Mead to purify Mead Hall by discovering the secrets of the ancient brewery, preventing the recipe from being reproduced and returned to its place of origin. Four-hour Adventure for 1st to 4th level characters. Optimized for APL3.

“If you drink, don't ride a sled.”
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Fabula Rasa: Seemannsgarn
Histoires 100 fins: Edition Pirates
boardgame.description:
In Fabula Rasa, players take turns telling a constantly changing story as is typical of oral traditions. The motifs on the cards provide visual bullet points for people, objects, and locations that are central to the action, things that must be remembered in the correct order, with cards disappearing and new ones being added each round. Those who, as a narrator, manage to present their version of the story without errors will be rewarded accordingly.

In Fabula Rasa: Seemannsgarn, players slip into the role of sea dogs who tell each other all sorts of fantastic stories in the harbor bar about sunken ships, treasure maps, pirates, mysterious islands, dangers, and adventures at sea.

listing.notes: Title: Fabula Rasa: Seemannsgarn Publisher: HUCH! Language(s): English

boardgame.name: The Ski Chalet of Artor Morlin
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

ARTOR MORLIN, the vampire Lord of Waterdeep, has come to Icewind Dale, thrilled at the lack of sunlight. He want to entice Halaster, the Mad Mage of Undermountain to come to Icewind Dale use his magic to create a ski chalet for their use.

However, he (reluctantly) needs the help of some adventurers to get plans and permits for the Ski Chalet. Can the adventurers survive the dangers of the wilderness of Icewind Dale and the tedium of an Upper Termalaine Homeowners' Association meeting, to aid a Lord of Waterdeep?

This Adventurers' League Dungeon Craft: Plague of Ancients adventure is designed for three to seven 1 - 4-level characters and is optimized for five characters with an average party level (APL) of 2. Characters outside this level range cannot participate in this adventure.

This adventure occurs in Icewind Dale within and around the village of Termalaine. It uses the adventure seed Snipe Hunt.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: The Last Refuge of Spring
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Last Refuge of Spring
A message is circulating within Easthaven requesting brave adventurers to mount a rescue expedition to the Spine of the World. The message reads:

Adventurers needed for a rescue mission. A team led by Rog Drannian has been lost near the Reghed Glacier. Drannyth Anteos is seeking adventurers who are daring enough to mount an expedition to locate the team and return them back to Easthaven. If you are interested, meet at The White Lady Inn on Twoday at 10:00 AM. You will be compensated for your time.

Wizards joining the expedition will find the compensation particularly rewarding.

With worsening weather, will the party be able to locate the missing group before the elements cause inevitable tragedy?

A four hour, Dungeoncraft Adventure for Plague of Ancients (Season 10) for characters level 5 - 10 (Tier 2, APL 8). Based upon the Adventure Seed This Seems Familiar.

Dungeon Masters take note: It is recommended that at least one Wizard join the party because they will find the magic items most rewarding.

This product includes a PDF version of the adventure, a .zip of the maps and handouts and a Fantasy Grounds Unity .mod file of the adventure. The Fantasy Grounds Unity module uses line of sight and dynamic lighting effects, allowing the party to witness light streaming through cracks in walls and the flickering of candles.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Horsing Around
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a DungeonCraft Adventure, for Season 10 Adventurers League set in Good Mead, Icewind Dale.

Your party finds itself arriving in icewind Dale on the night of Good Mead's election for the next town speaker. But an unknown candidate has shown up to disrupt the balance of power and the other candidates need you to... take care of them. But what's really going on in Good Mead?
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Totta vai tarua?
boardgame.description:
Can you spot the real items from the made up ones? Start your inner lie detector.

Everyone takes turns to be a reader, reading one card of six items on any given category. Other players use tokens to mark whether they think those are real or fake. Points are tallied, and after equal number of turns, highest score wins.

boardgame.name: My Loneliness is Killing You
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

My Loneliness is Killing You

A Dungeoncraft - Plague of Ancients Adventure

A hunting trip for legendary flightless bird in the Lonelywood Forest ends in a disaster. Will the characters survive the trip that seemed to be an easy task to earn some gold and fame?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters for 1st through 4th level. Optimized for APL 3.

This product includes the following:


PDF file of the adventure (4 Hour Main Adventure)
Dungeon Map (DM version)
Dungeon Map (Player versions with grid and gridless)


This adventure is legal for Adventurers League play.

You can play this adventure as part of for your Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden campaign.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Left Behind
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Some trappers in Caer-Konig need help finding their lost friends. During their last expedition they wandered near an ancient keep near the Reghed Glacier and barely escaped from an undead horde. Two of them weren’t so lucky and were cut off during the chase. It’s been a fortnight since the encounter; can the adventurer’s travel to this ancient fortress and rescue the missing trappers?
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: From the Midnight Sun
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Icewind Dale is a land of frozen mystery and terror, but this realm isn't without its whimsy. Fey shenanigans abound even during the time of Auril's curse. In "From the Midnight Sun," heroes learn about the fey intrigue gripping the land and enjoy run-ins with ancient fey manipulators Jeny Greenteeth, the Prince of Frost, the Sisters of Lament, and more. A simple fetch quest becomes a race for survival, culminating in an epic battle your players will certainly not forget.

"From the Midnight Sun" is beautifully laid out. Like our other works, this campaign book features original art. In the style of the Word Refinery and the D8 Summit, this product pushes the boundaries of typical presentation to create a rich and novel experience for player and Dungeon Master alike - all while promoting diverse voices in the gaming community.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: The Horror of Ashwood Crypt
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

VENTURE BENEATH THE RUINED CHURCH AND FACE THE EVIL THAT HAS STIRRED DEEP WITHIN THE CRYPTS!

The Horror of Ashwood Crypt is a challenging horror themed one-shot adventure for four to five players of 4th level. It can be easily dropped into any existing 5th edition game or run as a stand alone one shot adventure, and is expected to take between 4-6 hours of play time.

Test your players in a challenging horror-filled dungeon crawl with new monsters where threat of character death is real, and time can have terrible consequences!

boardgame.name: Jespatys Neldastar - Graviturgy Magic Wizard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Meet Jespatys Neldastar, a Draconblood Dragonborn Graviturgy Magic Wizard for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition.

Here you will find pregenerated character sheets that take this PC from levels 1 through 20.

All equipment was priced using the AncientWhiteArmyVet's D&D 5e Magic Arms and Armor Price Guide and AncientWhiteArmyVet's D&D 5e Wondrous Magic Item Price Guides.

boardgame.name: Tobias Steinmann - Chronurgy Magic Wizard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Meet Tobias Steinmann, a Rock Gnome Chronurgy Magic Wizard for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition.

Here you will find pregenerated character sheets that take this PC from levels 1 through 20.

All equipment was priced using the AncientWhiteArmyVet's D&D 5e Magic Arms and Armor Price Guide and AncientWhiteArmyVet's D&D 5e Wondrous Magic Item Price Guides.

boardgame.name: Tiefling Treatise
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Tiefling Treatise brings heaps of new lore and a queer focus for the tieflings of Eberron. Four unique origins are detailed within this fifth-edition supplement, ranging from tieflings influenced by Eberron's planes to those possessing a spark of the divine.

For DMs looking to add tieflings into the world, encounter tables are scattered throughout the book for quick and easy implementation. Additionally, the Tiefling Treatise contains information on the Venomous Demesne and sanctuary of Rellekor, providing cultural notes and plot hooks for those looking to visit these tiefling-dominated locales.

On the player side, this supplement contains race options that are tailor-made for the Eberron setting. For those looking for more in-depth character notes, culturally-significant trinkets and appearance guides can help you truly integrate your character into Khorvaire and beyond.

If you're a fan of fiend-touched, then come and crack open the Tiefling Treatise!

boardgame.name: How to Eat Ankheg
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ever wonder just how many monsters you could put on the dinner table? Just how many beasts have you vanquished and then left the precious meat to rot?

Here we'll be taking a look at the Ankheg, its culinary applications, and a few example recipes.

boardgame.name: Irmandinhos
boardgame.description:
"In the middle of the s. XV in Galiza several power struggles took place in different regions. The warring factions acted in order to gain sufficient influence to gain control of these regions.

The Marshal will move through the different regions and determine in which territory the revolt will take place while the 3 factions position their followers to stand in front.

Irmandinhos is a board game of political and military intrigue that takes place during the final period of the Second Irmandiña Revolt (1469) in which three players will assume the role of different important characters and will have to make secret decisions for the three factions to make. Control each of the regions in play according to your character's goals.

After completing the six rounds, the player with the most goals accomplished will be the winner."

The players program actions in a hidden way through the intrigue cards, choosing the order in which they will be carried out to try to make a certain faction obtain a greater presence in the territory where the battle takes place. These territories will vary during the game. The player who manages to meet the requirements set by his character card before the 6 rounds will be the winner of the game.

boardgame.name: Darkstalkers Resurrection
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You’ve probably heard this one before. The modern world, late 20th century. Humanity goes about it’s business as normal, living out their short little lives as best they can, all the while unaware of the truth of the world. Humanity is not alone on Earth, nor is Earth alone among worlds. They are the prey for dark forces beyond their understanding. These forces even have a name, given by those few humans in the know. The Darkstalkers.

boardgame.name: Ghost in the Shell Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

For this jump, you will enter a world not much different than our own in the year 2025, slightly after the events of World Wars Three and Four. The Third World War saw the use of tactical nuclear weapons, while the fourth world war saw numerous asymmetric battlefields, both of which greatly changing the political landscape. Socially, mankind has changed rapidly with the growing field of cybertechnology, interconnecting peoples' minds across the net and offering completely new bodies to those that need or want them. These shifts have led to new horizons for crime, and a world as dangerous as ever.

boardgame.name: Apeworld on Fire
boardgame.description:
From the company website:

Into the Future: More About Apeworld
Pontius Primate, religious psychopomp of the New Simian Army, has sent his cyber-ape holy warriors back through time. They're intent on kidnapping the scientists he needs to perfect a terrible mind-control gas that can strip the free will from countless victims at once!

Our heroes have chased them back to the future. In hot pursuit across the Wastelands, their journey will take them into the very heart of the simian capital of Apeworld and deep into the hidden laboratories beneath Pontius Primate’s cyber-fortress.

boardgame.name: Sins of the Exiled
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The faint, filthy smell of foul sorcery lingers almost feculently [sic] on the fetid air. Life source is what allows the living to think, to fight, to learn, to reason, and to live, thus the magic of life is simply pure power.

User summary:

The scenario is published as fifteen JPG image files, suitable for full-color printing (formatted for US Letter).

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming (Issue 58 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming

The Dark Crystal - Roleplaying in the world of Thra

boardgame.name: The Dark Crystal Adventure Game
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Explore the planet of Thra and discover the mysteries behind the Crystal of Truth in The Dark Crystal Adventure Game.
...
Set in the world of the original 1982 film and the recent Netflix television series, The Dark Crystal Adventure Game is an “easy to play” title for fans of the franchise. Releasing as a choose-your-own adventure style game, the RPG will include a 200 page campaign and tools to enable people to make their own stories in the world of Dark Crystal.

boardgame.name: Intro and Characters
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Another world… Another time… In the Age of Wonder.

Eight hundred years ago the land was green; until the Crystal cracked. A single piece was lost, the shard of the Crystal. One race was split in two and the otherworldly urSkeks transformed into Skeksis and urRu. The urRu migrated into the Valley of the Stones and the Skeksis took control of the Castle of the Crystal. For a time there was peace; now the shadow of conflict covers the land.

boardgame.name: Mysticism and Mechanics
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the land of Thra there is science and mysticism. Mechanics was brought by the UrSeks and Skeksis and is used in understanding and manipulating the order of things. Mysticism is hearing the Song of Thra to know and alter the shape of things. Mechanics and mysticism are not opposing forces; they are often used together for the betterment of life. In the wrong hands, they can also pervert and distort life.

boardgame.name: Inhabitants and Creatures
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The world of Thra is teeming with life and movement. Not even Aughra knows all the living creatures of the land and sea. This chapter contains brief information on some of the more common living things, but is in no way an extensive list.

boardgame.name: Lands and Waters
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Dark Crystal won most fans over through its use of visuals. Things were always moving; some vines were more animal than plant. Unless struck by the blight of the Dark Crystal, the world should feel in constant motion with a surprise around every corner. This chapter provides an overview of the known lands of Thra.

boardgame.name: Campaigns and Resources
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is a violent time for the world of Thra. The darkness of the Crystal spreads across the land and the races are entering war for the first time. The previous chapters outlined the general mechanics for using Fate Core, common creatures, and areas. Chapter 5 provides insights for how to use those mechanics and areas in your game as well as links to important reference materials.

boardgame.name: The Skeksis
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Eight hundred years ago the land was green; until the Crystal cracked. A new race appeared; the Skeksis. The new lords of the Castle of the Crystal governed over the land, but their cruelty and conceit has grown and their darkness spreads over Thra while they vie for higher positions and greater power under the light of the Dark Crystal.

boardgame.name: The Field of Fire
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Eight hundred years ago the land was green; until the Crystal cracked. Below the surface of the world, on Thra’s inner sun, a race was blossoming. The Firelings built their castles of crystal and flame under the prismatic glow of the Dark Crystal.

boardgame.name: Song Weaving
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This chapter adds additional songs available for characters and provides new mechanics for combining multiple songs into a single effect.

boardgame.name: The Trials
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Three Trials have been shown or mentioned in various media regarding the Dark Crystal, but little knowledge has been provided regarding the history. This supplement provides non-canon history to the three Trials, details two new trials, and provides game-play mechanics for incorporating the Trials into your War of the Dark Crystal Fate Core game.

boardgame.name: Rumadlanbalardakina
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

When playing in the world of the Dark Crystal, most players want to play gelfings. I’ve had a few comments from players regarding having trouble with concepts for podlings, given their pacifist nature (Hup’s “aggressiveness” was an anomaly, according to lore). Ruma is an example podling to incorporate in play as a PC, NPC, or to provide ideas for podling characters.

boardgame.name: Beneath the Surface of Thra
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Another world… Another time… In an Age of Terror.
Eight hundred years ago the land was green and life flourished in the caves, caverns, and tunnels below the surface of the world; until the Crystal cracked. Ancient wars were reignited and hideous distortions of life were created in the corrupting light of the Dark Crystal.

boardgame.name: Monster Olympics
boardgame.description:
Build your monster’s strength, speed, and scare to compete for the gold medal in the Monster Olympics!

The game is played over 15 rounds, with players playing simultaneously, trying to earn the most points by earning medals and advancing your monster as far as possible. All players will use the same dice pool for each roll, however each player determines how to use the dice.

In each round, you will roll 2 dice and then use those dice to determine which monster upgrade to use. Each monster upgrade advances certain tracks. At the end of the game, you will compare your Strength, Speed, and Scare to see who had the most in each category. You will also score your track with the lowest number.

Scoring - Medal Ceremony

You will compete in three contests consisting of Strength, Speed, and Scare. First, compare your number on the tracks with every other player. The player with the highest number on each track earns the Gold Medal, 7 points, and writes a 7 in the Scoring area under the Strength icon. The player with the next highest score earns the Silver Medal, 3 points. The next highest earns the Bronze Medal, 1 point. It is friendly scoring, so ties are shared. Then check your individual four tracks, and write the lowest number in the last scoring area. Add your score and the player with the highest score is the Monster Olympics Champion!

boardgame.name: Azeroth
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Azeroth, a land of magic and endless war. A world where dragons soar and demons prowl the night. The two major factions, The Horde and The Alliance, battle for, well honestly no one knows anymore, they just like killing one another. But don’t let the magical nature of this world fool you, for there is evil lurking everywhere, even in the heart of the planet itself. The Old Gods, the Twilight Cult, the Scourge, the Burning Legion, the Cult of the Damned, and many, many other threats abound on Azeroth.

boardgame.name: Peas Offering
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A duck-related dungeon room for the Miserable Dungeon Jam.

In ancient times, villagers in fear of the Duck God built an altar deep underground, trying to placate it with gifts and sacrifices - all in vain, until by chance they bred a plant that would provide the ultimate offering… the BLESSED PEA

Travellers were waylaid, murdered, and thrown into the underground lake to feed the plant, until their vengeful spirits woke again, killing the gardeners, emerging to slaughter the villagers, then returning to rest again under the water.

In the meantime, the duck god's avatar grows hungry…

boardgame.name: Don't Go In There
boardgame.description:
You play as meddling kid wandering too far into a creepy haunted house. You knew you shouldn't touch anything, but like any protagonist in a horror story, your curiosity got the best of you and now you've accidentally awoken an evil presence in the house. You'll have to undo the curse to escape with your sanity or forever be haunted!
It's a fast, easy-to-learn game that uses push your luck "set destruction." Decide how risky to play as you venture deep into the haunted house. Do you take first choice of the items and risk attracting haunts, or play it safe? Collect the right items and you can dispel some of your curses.

On your turn, choose a part of the haunted house to explore by placing a meeple in one of the 3 rooms. Each room has 5 placement spaces. The deeper you go into a room the more likely you are to get the cursed item you desire, but be careful! The further you go, the more ghosts will haunt you.

When 3 meeples have been placed into a room, the ghost dice are rolled. Depending on the result the placement of the meeples players will gain ghosts tokens. Next players will take cards from the room, depending on their meeple's position.

At the end of the game. The player with the most ghost tokens is haunted! They will gain curses equal to the number of ghosts they have collected. Players will then add up the curses from their ghosts and their item cards.

The player with the fewest curses wins!

boardgame.name: Word Fever
boardgame.description: The challenge in Word Fever is clear: one topic, one letter, and a word that starts with that letter in that topic. "Name something that didn't exist one hundred years ago and that starts with I." Find a solution quickly — "Internet!" — and be the first to hit the buzzer. The faster you answer, the more points you can win.
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Word Fever

boardgame.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 259 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
GTM: Game Trade Magazine
Issue No. 259
September

Galaxy Trucker

boardgame.name: Tanzania
boardgame.description:
Tanzania is a card game that will immerse you in the heart of Africa. Carnivorous animals, herbivores, herds and hunters will be the protagonists of a challenge full of threats, strategy and emotion.

In this game, each participant must avoid all the threats present to make their animals survive in the African savanna.


Objective: Be the first player to save 20 animals.

Contents: 50 animal cards, 35 situation cards, 35 hunter cards, 1 hand token, 1 regulation.

TANZANIA is a semi-cooperative card game.

Animal cards are dealt to each player and a situation card is raised (Day in the open field / Sunset at the river / Night in the grasslands).

Then an animal card is played trying not to lose it. When playing a carnivore you have to hunt. When playing a herbivore you have to avoid being hunted.
Each animal card has a score according to the situation card previously drawn.

By playing the same card as another participant, a pack is formed, increasing the score of the cards that comprise it.

Despite having stronger cards and weaker cards, the fact of forming a pack and playing as a team equates the weakest with the strongest.

At the end of the hand a hunter card is raised. In case one comes out, he hunts the strongest animal on the table, modifying the outcome of the round.

The strategy of the game is to know when to play each animal, since by playing a weak card you run the risk of being hunted by another animal and by playing a strong card you run the risk of being hunted by a hunter.

The first player to save 20 animals wins the game.

boardgame.name: El Sincero
boardgame.description:
How well you know your friends and family?

A board game for that group with whom you know each other from head to toe.

Each participant chooses a color and the totems and boards are distributed. The boards are placed in the center of the table with the pawn at the beginning. Voting cards are also distributed to each player.

The personality cards are placed face down on the table. A personality card is revealed and read and everyone must vote by placing their card face down. After everyone has voted, the voting cards are turned over and the votes are counted.

Players who agreed the most votes win and advance. The first player to complete a lap wins!

boardgame.name: Beetlejuice: Joke Cards Game
boardgame.description:
Beetlejuice: Joke Cards Game is a simple card collection game using characters from the Emmy winning Sunday morning cartoon "BEETLEJUICE" from the early 90s.

Beetlejuice the great jokester, has a great variety of Nutty Knock-knocks, Spooky Riddles, Snappy Put-Downs, and Groaners in this wild and crazy game. Be the first player to travel along the spooky path to Lydia's house by collecting joke card combinations. In addition to collecting sets and runs of joke cards, answering the riddles will score players bonus points.

Each turn the current player draws the top card from either the draw pile or discard. Cards in hand are used to complete sets of three (any suit, same number), or a run of three (same suit, consecutively numbered) as in Rummy. Redeeming a set or run moves the player's score token one step closer to victory.

Every step of the score track denotes a joke card suit. When scoring, a bonus point maybe awarded if the player can correctly answer the riddle corresponding to the scoring space they just moved to.

First player to the final space wins.

boardgame.name: Mhâ'Nhârd's Hatchlings
boardgame.description:
From the description:

An ancient laboratory.

7 stone eggs. 1 empty.

The liquid of life may break their prison

and death shall come to the one making the donation.

boardgame.name: Brighter Day
boardgame.description:
Probably the most colorful horror game you've ever played. Hide from moaning disembodied eyeballs while facing existential dread, ambient music, and alternative medicine.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Release the Quacken!
boardgame.description: Release the Quacken! is a passageway and a helmet for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: The Fowl Fountain
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The fowl Fountain is a dungeon room that can be placed in your dungeon with a cursed item to tempt the players with.

boardgame.name: Rent-A-Ghost
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Join the dole queue of the Working Dead!

One page role-playing, comedy story-telling game about very odd ghosts doing very odd jobs, strongly influenced by 1970s British Children's Telly, the rigours of improvisational theatre and the childhood joys of scoffing sweets!

Each player creates and takes on the role of a peculiar ghost, hired by Rent-a-Ghost Ltd. to solve a problem for one of its many awkward customers. All the players help generate the situation, and then work together using their stupendously spooky supernatural powers to save the day, all while sharing sweets and trying to make each other laugh.

Madcap mayhem for 2-6 players.

Additional Equipment Required:

In addition to the rules each player will also need
- 12 sweets to eat and share
- 2 normal six-sided dice to roll

boardgame.name: Mezcla2
boardgame.description:
Mezcla2 proposes solving challenges in groups of 2 or 3 people. It consists of a deck of cards with images of characters that make different mimics and another with slogans / challenges. Each player must meet with those who have the same card and solve the slogan. The judge will decide which group wins and scores points. Then all the cards will be shuffled to start a new game with a new group and judge. This game proposes slogans that will never be solved in the same way because they depend on each group.

Mezcla2 is an invitation to meet others, get to know each other and take action to solve as a team.

A game that promotes cooperation, group work and adaptation.

boardgame.name: A game about drawing creatures, complimenting the drawings, then complimenting the compliments.
boardgame.description:
50+ cards that tell you attributes you need to draw ('creature features') and offer compliment guidance on the other side.

Draw 1 communal 'creature feature' and give 3 cards to each player. Everyone draws a creature with four 'creature features', ending with some weird creatures.

Secondly, everyone has to compliment everyone else's creatures.

Finally, each artist has to compliment one of the compliments that were given to them.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Paper Dungeons: Wipeable score card
boardgame.description: A wipeable score card for Paper Dungeons.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Paper Dungeons: A Dungeon Scrawler Game

boardgame.name: Barrage: Executive Officer Promo C
boardgame.description:
A new executive officer for Barrage, originally distributed at Modena Play 2021.

Amir Zahir :
Whenever you place Water Drops on the Headstreams, you can decide to make them flow immediately (you need to decide for each single Water Drop). When you are supposed to place Water Drops that should flow immediately on the Headstreams, you can place them directly in one of your Dams with enough capacity to hold them (you need to decide for each single Water Drop).

If, during your turn you decide to copy this power with Mahiri Sekiho, you will obtain Amir Zahir's ability for the current turn.

listing.notes: New in plastic

boardgame.name: Face-Off
boardgame.description:
Box back

Following on from our number one game Manchester United Europe, Kristalis presents "Face Off Ice Hockey". Game features:
Four player management option, substitutions (animated 1 meg Amiga), name of player in possession of the puck, full screen action, sin bin, ability to turn the referee off, 30 different countries complete with flags and managers, upto fice levels of difficulty, action replays, load and save game, pre-match entertainment, your own team doctor, the ability to view yur players' individual strenghts and weaknesses, team training with three different diciplines, speech (Atari ST), team tactics (including the option to fight dirty!), fighting, team statistics, icemarks (Amiga), arcade only option (based on the Manchester United Europe game logic), management only option, or full simulation option

boardgame.name: Stormworks
Stormworks: Build and Rescue
boardgame.description:
Build, Plan, Rescue

STORMWORKS is the game where you design and pilot your own sea-rescue service, in a rich and dramatic physics playground.

Steer or fly your custom-designed, block based, programmable vehicles into fierce oceanic storms. Plan and execute thrilling rescues in a variety of challenging crisis scenarios.

Vehicle Designer

Design vehicles by placing blocks in a rich editing suite, decorate with paint, and program the behaviour using the powerful logic system. Choose from a wide array of tools and components for designing planes, helicopters, boats, and more.

Physics Sandbox

Test your designs to their limit in a physics driven sandbox simulation, where your vehicles performance is a direct result of your design. Use the dial and indicator components to display feedback on the vehicles logic system, while examining your vehicle's handling, buoyancy, and stability in fierce weather.

Logistical Challenges

Embark on missions to operate your sea-rescue service. Design and deploy new vehicle designs to respond to the logistical and emergency scenarios across the open ocean, island facilities, rigs, and more.

Dramatic Simulated World

The day-night cycle, and dynamic weather system creates diverse environments, from calm still sunny mornings, to fierce stormy nights. Strong winds can turn the ocean simulation from gentle ripples to fierce heaving waves, all while the vehicles simulate a physically based displacement-buoyancy system.

Multiplayer

Join your friends in cooperative multiplayer as you operate multi-crew vehicles, and execute complex missions involving careful planning and coordination.

Environmental Simulations

The day-night cycle and dynamic weather system create diverse environments to put your creations to the test. From calm sunny mornings, to unforgiving stormy nights and even tsunamis - strong winds can turn the ocean from gentle ripples to fierce heaving waves, affecting your vehicles using physics-based hydrodynamics and displacement-buoyancy systems.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: European Champions
Lothar Matthäus: Die interaktive Fußballsimulation
Olympique de Marseille
Retee 2!
boardgame.description:
Box back
NOW,... a soccer simulation that combines realism with fast arcade action! Check out just some of many amazing play features:

*TWIN VIEWS - Select either FAST-ACTION TOP-DOWN or the realistic GRANDSTAND VIEW. Just hit the key and the switch is made - the game doesn't stop for a moment!

*TACTICS - Select one of the many, easy set up BUILD-IN-TACTICS options or DESIGN YOUR OWN!

*INTELLIGENT PASSING - Choose one of three different modes for pixel-perfect passing.

*ONE TOUCH FOOTBALL - Build up moved quickly and fluidly. Anyone can look good, and if you are good you'll PLAY LIKE A GENIUS.

*SPECTACULAR - Large, SUPERBLY ANIMATED players looks as if they're ready to burst out of your screen!

*REALISTIC - Varianle wind direction, wind speed and pitch conditions that really INFLUENCE THE GAME-PLAY.

*ACTION REPLAYS - Select to replay in either GRANDSTAND or TOP-DOWN mode. Featuring FULL VIDEO CONTROLS (rewind, fast forward, freeze frame, slow motion), You can even change the camera angle during a replay to find out what was happening elsewhere on the pitch!

boardgame.name: Biomas Iberia
boardgame.description:
You are in charge of the repopulation of various biomes of the Iberian Peninsula with its most characteristic fauna: lynx, wolves and brown bears. Each animal has its preferences, if you respect them, meet the objectives of the game and manage to place more animals than your opponent in the biomes, you will earn affinity points. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game is the winner!

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

boardgame.name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Trident-class Assault Ship
Star Wars: X-Wing Segunda Edición – Nave de asalto clase Tridente
boardgame.description:
Whether spearheading surprise attacks on key Republic facilities or pirate raids on innocent worlds, the Trident-class assault ship heralds the arrival of hostile forces, emerging ominously from the seas of stars. Armed with crushing tentacles and capable of operating in space, atmosphere, or the ocean’s depths, these versatile warships present an unorthodox threat that can strike unexpectedly to seize control of nearly any battlefield. Inside you will find multiple new Huge Ship Upgrade cards, Quick Build cards, and several new scenarios for using this craft: Rising Tide, a head-to-head scenario, and Leviathan Hunt, a co-operative scenario where multiple players work together to bring down a single Trident-class assault ship controlled by a simplified Solo System AI deck. This pack includes everything you need to add 1 Trident-class Assault Ship to your game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: True Legacy
boardgame.description:
Synopsis

The near future. The effects of computer intelligence and robotics on employment. The morality and politics of human genetics.

TRUE LEGACY takes place in a near future of monstrous metropolises, uncontrollable unemployment, and state oversight. Aspirations are reserved for the privileged.

You are Thornhill, a career city investigator, institutionally loyal with a worn sense of protocol. The perfect choice for this type of investigation.

Interactive Format

The game takes the format of a text based interactive story adventure, overlayed above rich interactive 3D hand crafted scenes.

Storyline

Five chapters lead you through a dark noir adventure, a city investigation in a dystopian future, that collides with the morality and politics of A.I., robotics, and human genetics.

Graphics

Interactive scenes lay behind and between the typography of the story. These scenes are beautifully crafted interactive illustrations.

Puzzles

Explore the world and narrative for information and clues and solve interactive puzzles.

Science

True Legacy is developed in collaboration with scientific experts and specialists in the fields of forensics, artificial intelligence, and robotics.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Lorenzo Il Magnifico: Promo Visconti/Della Scala
boardgame.description:
2 new families, originally included in the New Edition of Lorenzo il Magnifico (Lorenzo il Magnifico + Famiglie del Rinascimento + La Congiura dei Pazzi)

Visconti
Before the Family Tiles auction, draw 2 Leader Cards and place them face up next to this tile. If you take this Family Tile, take the 2 Leader Cards and the 5 Visconti tokens (put the tokens in front of you on the non-active side). Whenever you play a Leader Card, activate a token (flip it on the side with a "check" symbol) of your choosing and receive its bonus. You also receive the bonus of all the tokens you have already activated. Note: if you play more than 5 Leader Cards, activate all the tokens when you play them.

The 5 tokens bonuses are : 2 coins / 1 wood + 1VP / 1 stone + 1VP / 1 Faith Point / 1 Military Point + 1 servant

Della Scala
Whenever you receive a Council Privilege, you can take any bonus except for Faith Points, but you receive 1 additional Faith Point. In addition, you can exchange 1 Faith Point for 1 coin, 1 servant and 1 Military Point any number of times.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Lorenzo il Magnifico: Houses of Renaissance

boardgame.name: Elemonsters: Das Kartenspiel
boardgame.description:
The Monsters are unleashed. And only a master of the elements can defeat them.
The whole world contains only less than 100 chemical elements. Everything we know is made from them. But what, if the elements would come alive as monsters?
In this game, you can let the monsters fight each other. You can create chemical compounds and learn interesting things from the world of chemistry.
Elemonsters in action.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Die Monster sind los! Und nur ein Meister der Elemente kann sie bezwingen.
Die ganze Welt besteht aus weniger als 100 Elementen. Alles was wir kennen, ist aus ihnen gemacht. Was aber wenn die Elemente als Monster lebendig werden?
Mit diesem Spiel kannst du Monster gegeneinander kämpfen lassen, Verbindungen erschaffen und Interessantes aus der Welt der Chemie erfahren.
Elemonsters in Aktion!

—description from the publisher (translated)

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieler Spieldauer: 30 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 8
Elemonsters - Die chemische Elemente als Monster In einer parallelen Welt sind die chemischen Elemente als Monster lebendig geworden. Sie kämpfen gegeneinander oder bilden Allianzen. Nur ein Meister der Elemente kann sie bezwingen.
Ziel des Spiels ist es, Verbindungen in verschiedenen Kategorien abzulegen (zB. Moleküle oder Ionen) um damit Punkte zu sammeln. Dazu duellieren sich die Spieler unter Einsatz der Elemente-Eigenschaften. Vorkenntnisse sind hierbei nicht erforderlich aber hilfreich. Die Karten sind gespickt mit vielen interessanten Informationen, die mit Liebe zum Detail grafisch umgesetzt wurden. Auf diese Weise lernen die Spieler ganz nebenbei chemische Grundkenntnisse. Daher eignet sich das Spiel auch für den Einsatz im Unterricht.
Die zugehörige kostenlose App erweitert das Kartenspiel um eine Augmented Reality Funktion: Die Monster auf den Karten werden lebendig und fangen an sich zu bewegen. Eine akustische Umsetzung des Emissionsspektrums bringt die Elemente zum Klingen. Doch damit nicht genug: Erkennt die App zwei oder mehr Elemente, zeigt sie an, welche Verbindungen damit möglich sind. Außerdem kann sie den Punktestand im Spiel berechnen und bietet Erklärvideos zur Spielanleitung.
Entwickelt wurde das Spiel von Andreas Dihm, der für das Projekt Elemonsters mit dem Preis Kultur- und Kreativpiloten Deutschland ausgezeichnet wurde. Präsentiert wird das Spiel von der Gesellschaft Deutscher Chemiker GDCh.
Inhalt: 72 Karten Anleitung
https://youtu.be/C5WJY8iJDbg
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: Stuffed Fables: Oh, Brother! – Feldherr Insert
boardgame.description: For safe and clear storage of all game material in the original game box of the "Stuffed Fables" expansion "Oh, Brother!"

boardgame.name: Twen Politspiel: Werden Sie Kanzler
boardgame.description:
Each player chooses a starting position (CDU, SPD, FDP, APO) from wich to reach the "Kanzler"-Space to win the game. Movement is determined by a die. On the roll of a 6, the player may leave the starting space or, if this happens during play, he gets a free turn. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the player. Each player has to travel around the outer ring, before he may enter the inner ring, by getting on a T-space. If a player gets on a K-space he may choose to take the risky shortcut.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Der Taubertal-Express
boardgame.description:
The prosperous railway town of Lauda, ​​Baden-Wuerttemberg, Germany, early 20th century. The players slip into the role of railway pioneers and builders. They carry famous passengers of contemporary history and open up numerous industrial and railway buildings in the entire Taubertal and in the wider area. With the expansion of the railway town of Lauda, ​​the players gain increasing influence. With all of this, a clever and forward-looking planning is rewarded. Full steam ahead: Let's go for an exciting railway experience!

How to play the game: Every player starts the journey with a steam locomotive, a basic coal wagon and a wagon for workers. In every round the players choose from different sets of action markers. Then they use these five-coloured action markers to perform the following actions:


Move your steam locomotive on your own player board and deliver passengers to their destination
Place specific buildings on your player board (according to the corresponding colours):
With the train buildings you expand the train station of Lauda and move your pioneer marker forward.
With industrial buildings you can produce different transport goods for your transport wagon.
With the wagon halls you provide new transport wagons, passenger wagons or worker wagons (expanding the steam locomotive with a smart puzzle mechanism!).

Take an extra ticket from the game board and put it an your passenger wagon
Produce, load and sell transport goods to earn coins and points


You will take turns (7 x 3 rounds). During final scoring, you will receive extra points for specific railway buildings.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dune: CHOAM & Richese
boardgame.description:
This expansion adds two new factions, the CHOAM and the Richese, to the Dune boardgame, along with 2 new variants.

The Combine Honnete Ober Advancer Mercantiles or CHOAM controlled much of the economic affairs across the cosmos, and had a keen interest in Arrakis above and beyond spice production. Because of its control of inter-planetary commerce, CHOAM was the largest single source of wealth in the Imperium. Influence in CHOAM was a major focus of political maneuvering in the Imperium, both to maximize dividends and also to skim profits. The leaders and bureaucrats of CHOAM were dedicated to controlling vital products that enriched the Great Houses . . . and CHOAM itself.

House Richese, just like the Ixians, had a well-earned reputation for ingenuity, and created important technological inventions. But Count Ilban Richese suffered a number of business blunders that threatened to bankrupt their fortunes. After being ousted from governing Arrakis, they were reduced to selling off important creations simply to raise enough funds to continue their efforts to compete.

This expansion also introduces Leader Skills, which let you assign a skill like Mentat, Swordmaster of Ginaz, or Prana Bindu Adept to one of your leader discs. It also included Advanced Stronghold Cards, which give you a "homefield advantage" when battling in a stronghold you control.

—description from the publisher
