Brand new unused.

Sleeved, shipping costs based on distance/country of destination*. Payment by PayPal or Revolut.
*in Europe 2€ for regular letter and 4€ for tracked/insured letter
Post to UK only is £1

boardgame.name: Accessible Gaming Quarterly (Issue 202 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

For Year 2, we plan on covering a similarly wide array of topics and intend to hone in on more creative content. We'll cover...

Interviews with game designers, Game Masters, and players.
Creative content, including spotlights on disabled heroes and adventurers. New ideas for incorporating accessibility tools and aids into modern, sci-fi, fantasy, and other games.
Write-ups to showcase how disabled characters can be built using various RPG systems.
Adventure ideas that put disabled characters at the center of the action, not on the sidelines or as props.
Art by disabled artists and their allies.
...and more!
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: How One Blind Person Reads large Blocks of Text Without Sounding Like It
Questions and Answers with Accessible Games

boardgame.name: Paladin Jam
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Even in this dying land, some fools still believe in concepts like FAITH and MERCY and JUSTICE. They come to this place, guided by rumors of great knowledge and piety.

We ambush them, murder them, and squish them into delicious jellies.

PALADIN JAM is a one-page supplement for Mörk Borg presenting a single item that adventures may find in their miserable travels.

boardgame.name: Two-Faced Assilisk
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Birthed from her anus. Cast into the public toilets of Bergen Chrypt. Patron of paladins and other assholier-than-thou antagonists.

Contains lore and two tables of demands and consequences. No actual mechanics to speak of, which is how you can tell it's a Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: Mauszauber
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Giving 48 New spells to use in your Mausritter games these spells center around 4 main concepts, plants, the elements, the stars, snakes, time, and much more.

boardgame.name: Magic Bell
boardgame.description: A magic item for Mausritter.

boardgame.name: Sea of Legends: Vengeance of the Empires
boardgame.description:
War amongst the Great Powers of Europe has engulfed the Americas. The Spanish Empire’s hold over the Caribbean has been slipping for decades as they compete with rival empires. Now the Spanish Empire looks to reestablish their hold over their colonies to bolster their efforts in Europe. France has marshaled their forces to expand their own presence to ensure their access to the goods and resources of the Americas. But older and stranger forces have also awoken in the murky depths of these ancient waters. Sailors tell tall tales of a haunted ship, the Flying Dutchman, and its ghostly crew. There are also whispered warnings about the mighty Kraken, rising from the depths to hunt those that dare to sail upon the waters.

The Great Powers are gathering on the seas, seizing control of the ports, and punishing all rivals. Is the Golden Age of Piracy at an end? Or will you make deals, manipulate events to your advantage, and become the greatest pirate of them all? Hold fast, gather your crew, ready your cannons and muskets, and prepare for the Vengeance of the Empires.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Boons of Battle
boardgame.description:
"Reap the Rewards of Boons of Battle!

Boons of Battle provides a multitude of rules reworks, supplements, alternatives and additions to add to one of the most fundamental parts of DnD - combat.

Employ new mechanics in your gameplay with 4 alternate rules - Remove Curse, Unconsciousness, Critical Hits, and Spell Scrolls
Explore new options with 3 new feats - Gladiator, Sunderer and Guerilla
Expand your encounter range with 2 new rulesets - Diplomacy and Duels
Expedite your combat with 2 rules reworks - Vision and Mounted Combat
And the best part - it's free! Use Boons of Battle in home games of your own, in published campaigns, or in this supplement's tagalong adventure, The Coliseum."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Carnevale: Escape from San Canciano
boardgame.description:
In 1793 a great calamity hit the world. The Rent in the Sky tore apart the heavens, destroying most of Italy and flooding Europe. Only one place survived mysteriously unscathed: Venice. In the years since, the Floating City has become a beacon of hope and trade, even as the Rent gazes balefully down, putting the city into a permanent twilight. The residents have changed and adapted to a new world, a world of magic and monsters.

Creatures live deep in the canals, brought through the great tear in reality. These Rashaar are masked by the Church of Dagon, an openly benevolent sect whose home is in the flooded district of San Canciano, among the crumbling buildings and dirty canals.

But there are others in the city that suspect more is afoot. The Guild -- a shadowy organisation of thieves and murderers -- orders the citizens around. The Guild protect them from evils of the city, but the cost is their loyalty and servitude. The King of Thieves has sent a small gang into San Canciano to discover its secrets, but once they do, the Rashaar will try as hard as they can to make sure no one makes it out alive.

This box contains everything that two players will need to dip their toes into the foetid canals of Carnevale. Get ready to swim, row, climb, and jump your way across the city in a game that places movement at its core. Whether you're skulking the winding streets, assassinating foes from the rooftops, or drowning them under the water, Carnevale offers fully three-dimensional gameplay in a narrative skirmish game.

Contained within are 2 small gangs -- the Guild and the Rashaar. There is a full 48-page rulebook explaining the lore and rules of the game, as well as a campaign to play through. Everything in this set is designed to get you playing quickly: from the single-piece models, through to the push-together cardboard scenery, fold-out play mat, dice, and even quick reference cards for characters, rules, and two scenarios to help teach the basics of the game.


8 Resin Characters: Both the Guild and Rashaar have four characters unique to this box. From the Gondolier with her bladed oar to the tentacled mouth of the Lesser Rhyll, all are covered in beautiful detail, and are all single-piece so you can get gaming quickly.
Cardboard Scenery: Terrain is important in Carnevale, so we're providing you with loads! 3 buildings, 7 obstacles, a bridge, and even a gondola! There's also a double-sided 2'x2' fold-out paper mat to set up your game easily.
48-Page Rulebook, Dice, Range Ruler, & Quick Reference Cards: This gorgeously presented book has the full rules for the game, accompanied with stunning artwork and background for all factions. With all the gaming aids you need, you’ll be playing in no time!


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Carnevale: Vicious Fighting Along the Canals of Venice
Carnevale: Vicious Fighting Along the Canals of Venice

boardgame.name: Drifting Sepulchre
boardgame.description:
From the description:

a little something something for the Mörk Borg miserable dungeon jam! the theme was something fowl (emphasis on the duck), so we decided to place our cult to the terrible duck god in the middle of Lake Onda. enjoy!

boardgame.name: Topo
boardgame.description:
Topo ("Mole") is a 3-part hidden role-play game with succinct rules that can be learned in just a few minutes. But don't be fooled by its apparent simplicity, to win consistently you will have to control the fine balance between deduction and intuition.

Two participants cooperate to achieve a common goal while the third sabotages their plans from the shadows. Sooner or later where Topo is played someone is going to lie. Can you find out before it's too late?

Social deduction games like this usually require many participants. With Topo we try to reduce that number to the minimum possible without losing the essence of the genre, which is the tension resulting from the balance between deduction and confusion.


Topo is a game for three, where two participants cooperate to achieve a common goal while a third ("El Topo") sabotages their plans from the shadows.

In turns, the players will deposit chips (of three types) in boxes to form different combinations.

The objective of the cooperators is to achieve the five combinations indicated on the board. The objective of the Mole is to sabotage the boxes that may contain these combinations ten times.

boardgame.name: This Didn't Happen
boardgame.description:
This Didn't Happen is a card game about changing history to nullify the apocalypse. Travel through time with 1-4 players, gathering supplies, changing events, and fiddling with the time-stream. Each player has a unique time traveler with individual strengths and weaknesses.

The goal is to change key events throughout history and cause enough changes that the apocalypse doesn't happen. Changing one event can cause others to change, too! With planning and precision, you can change several key events by changing only one event. However, without planning or caution, you may cause the world to tumble into an even darker timeline! Remember, if anything goes wrong: This didn't happen!

Players travel from event to event, either by waiting for time to move them or by using the Time Machine. Players collect supply cards, which help them during random events or which can be used to change the event their character is on. Changing an event can affect future events, softening them up and making them easier to change, or changing them outright. Changing too many events may cause a change to the End of the Era, resulting in an earlier apocalypse.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Watson & Holmes II
boardgame.description:
After the original Watson & Holmes, more adventures are coming.

Watson & Holmes II is a game of deduction. One to seven aspiring detectives step into the shoes of Doctor Watson, working alongside the detective Sherlock Holmes to try to solve a series of so far unpublished cases directly extracted from Doctor John H. Watson's diaries. Those who accept the challenge relive the adventures of the crime-solving duo, visiting each of the locations where the inquiries were made. Following the trail, each clue brings players closer to solving the case.

New adventures, new special rules and new challenges. Now you can play the game competitively, in teams, cooperatively or solo.

The game is afoot again!

boardgame.name: The Game of Life: Super Mario Edition
El juego de LIFE: Super Mario
boardgame.description:
In The Game of Life: Super Mario Edition board game, players choose to play as Mario, Luigi, Peach, or Yoshi, journeying through the Mushroom Kingdom, and finally spinning to win in a battle against Bowser! They move around the looping paths of the gameboard as they collect coins, power up with items and Companions, and play fun minigames along the way such as Rock Paper Scissors, Thumb Wars, and Spin-Offs. As they approach Bowser's Castle, players will also buy stars to boost their battle-spin; each star collected adds 1 point to their spin total, and players will need to spin higher than a 12 to defeat Bowser and win the game.


INSPIRED BY SUPER MARIO: It's The Game of Life board game with an exciting twist featuring Super Mario video game-inspired characters, artwork, and gameplay
BATTLE BOWSER: Unlike classic The Game of Life board game, this edition isn't about money or retirement. The ultimate goal in this board game for kids is to defeat Bowser
MINIGAMES AND STARS: Use coins to buy stars for a boost in the battle against Bowser. Compete in fun minigames in a face-off for prizes, and power up with Items and Companions
FUN FAMILY GAME: The Game of Life: Super Mario Edition board game is a great choice for game night with the family, and it's a fun indoor game for kids ages 8 and up, for 2-4 players


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Video Game Theme: Super Mario Bros.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Monster Manual Expanded III
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Unleash over 320 Terrifying New Monsters!

Monster Manual Expanded III, as with the two previous Adamantine Best-Selling books, aids dungeon masters by providing them with additional creature options to dress up their adventures. This 286-page bestiary contains 320 statblocks and over 140 original, magnificent pieces of artwork that will inspire dungeon masters and terrify players!

boardgame.name: Time to Hunt
狩猎时刻
boardgame.description: a game that clearly aims to be Monster Hunter but on mobile.

boardgame.name: Eleven: Unique set up deck
boardgame.description:
A deck of 8 cards allowing for an asymmetric start of the game. Each card is double sided with a positive effect on the one side and negative effect on the other. Each player draws 2 cards and choose which of them they should play on positive and which of them on negative side. This decision gives that player head start in one direction, and impact slightly the rest of the game.

This is an optional module for Eleven: Football Manager Board Game increasing the variability of the game. Without it, all players start the game symmetrically.

boardgame.name: Nova Aetas Renaissance: Draco
boardgame.description:
On the hills of Civita di Bagnoregio, protected by a mist that seems eternal, an extraordinary creature lies almost asleep.
Guardian of a cleft in the tuff capable of making imaginary worlds dream.

With this expansion, you will be able to play this huge creature both in Nova Aetas with a mini-campaign of 3 Hunt missions, and in Black Rose Wars as a Forgotten Spell.

Contents:
1x Draco Miniature (wingspan over 250mm)
30x Cards
1x Map Tile
1x Rulebook

boardgame.name: Nova Aetas Renaissance: Dice
boardgame.description:
These fantastic dice will allow each player to have their own set.
Personalized by friezes and characterized by their own color, they are a very useful accessory, especially if the group consists of 3 or more players.

Contents:
8x Eight-faces Dice

boardgame.name: Beast of Kaunas
Kauno žvėris
boardgame.description:
Take a trip around Kaunas and collect the most secrets! Mysterious beastly board game for the whole family.

Story: Kaunesians adore secrets, and they are looking for them all over the Sunny and Underground Kaunas. Players will learn why the Beast dinners more often in Kaunas Lagoon than in the Nemunas, what molluscs can be found in Santaka, what houses the ghosts live in and when there may be an opportunity to meet the Kaunas Beast.
They learn most of the secrets when they meet the Kaunas Beast. Be the first player to collect the 10 secrets with ingenuity and cunning!

Players choose a character and then pick cards to move to different locations in the city. depending on their role, they can question the Kaunas Beast to learn its secrets. The first player to get 10 secrets wins.

boardgame.name: D is for Dungeon
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Inside this terrible xanthic tome you will find: 1 Dungeon, 1 Character Class, 1 Magic Omnoculous, 23 Tables to roll on, 26 Flies (or more), 489 Monsters and Beasts to fight, and 1 Voracious Vegetable! So grab your polyhedral dice and your sordid progeny and forge some quality time together.

This Mork Borg Compatible alphabet book is both a functioning children's book (it's been Beta tested by my own sordid progeny) and a collection of useful randomizers for playing Mork Borg (or other ttrpgs). I hope it will bring you and your littlies the joy of discovered narrative.

boardgame.name: Elric: Rise of the Young Kingdoms
boardgame.description:
The City is burning! Imrryr, the Dreaming City, sparkling capital of the Melnibonean empire, is prey to the plundering of its former vassals.

Led by Elric, a prince banished from the Empire, these unlikely allies are rushing down on the city like a swarm of scavengers, making their way through a bloody path to the imperial palace...and its legendary wealth!

Traps, mercenaries, demons — no danger frightens them for who carries away the most precious spoils might well become the new master of the Young Kingdoms — if he survives the awakening of the Dragons...

boardgame.name: Impro: hullunhauska seurapeli
boardgame.description:
The title "Impro: hullunhauska seurapeli" translates from Finnish to "Impro: a crazy fun board game".

The game combines insightful questions and the pitch-black humor of the therapy world.

The game is prepared by setting up the game board on the table. The hourglass along with the Psychiatric Hospital card are placed next to the board. The category cards are placed on separate decks on the table. The five different categories: Emotion, Creativity, Mental Health, Self-knowledge and Task.

The youngest player starts and the game proceeds clockwise. The players move their pawns on the board according to the die and depending on which category they land, they pick a card and read it out loud. The category depicts how the player will execute the card: verbally, artistically, using their body language, facial expressions, or their wild imagination.

Depending on the correct guesses and/or successful execution of the card, the player and the co-players can move forward on the game board. The die is used in the beginning of one's turn until the homestretch, the rest of the way is moved forward only by completing the categories or guessing right. The player who reaches the finish square first is the winner. If two or more players get to the finish square in the same round, the game ends in a tie.

—description from publisher (translated)


IMPRO lautapeli on hullunhauska seurapeli. Pelissä yhdistyy terapiamaailman musta huumori ja oivalluksia herättävät kysymykset sekä tehtävät.

Peli valmistellaan asettamalla pelilauta pöydälle. Tiimalasi ja Psykiatrinen sairaala-kortti sijoitetaan pelilaudan viereen. Kysymyskortit laitetaan kategorioittain pinoihin pöydälle. Pelissä on viisi eri kategoriaa: Tunne, Luovuus, Mielenterveys, Itsetuntemus ja Tehtävä.

Nuorin pelaaja aloittaa ja peli jatkuu myötäpäivään. Pelaajat liikuttavat pelinappuloita nopan silmäluvun mukaan ja nostavan sen kategorian kysymyskortin, johon pelinappula päätyy. Pelaaja lukee kysymyskortin ääneen ja noudattaa kategorian mukaisesti kortin ohjeita. Riippuen kategoriasta, pelaaja suorittaa kortin verbaaliikan, taiteellisuuden, kehonkielen, kasvojen ilmeiden tai villin mielikuvituksen avulla.

Oikeiden vastausten ja menestyksekkäästi suorituksen mukaan pelaajat pääsevät etenemään pelilaudalla. Noppaa käytetään jokaisen pelivuoron alussa, kunnes saavutaan kultaiselle loppusuoralle. Loppusuoralla pelaajat etenevät ainoastaan kategorioita suorittamalla tai vastaamalla oikein. Maaliin ensimmäisenä saapunut pelaaja on voittaja. Jos kaksi tai useampi pelaaja saavuttaa maalin samalla kierroksella, peli päättyy tasapeliin.

—description from publisher (Finnish)

boardgame.name: Logic Bomb
boardgame.description:
A card game of logical matching and mental gymnastics for one to four players.

Win bytes by finding correct matches between symbols using the Boolean operations AND, OR, NOR and XOR – and their opposites.

There are three different ways to play: the Speed Game is about finding matches quickly, the Strategy Game requires thought and planning, and the Solo Game is an absorbing option for one player.

There’s a master of logic within you, and it’s time to let it out!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monster Description Cards
boardgame.description:
Subtitle: For Writers, Storytellers and GMs

Publisher's description:

Sometimes, it only takes one distinct characteristic for a monster to stick in our memories forever.

Sometimes, it’s the nuances in a battle that makes a strike so beautifully epic.

Sometimes, it's the monster’s crazed, desperate last moments that cause others to shudder.

Monster Description Cards are extensive storytelling tools suitable for use with any system, containing purposely unique flavor text to add realism or memorable characterization to creatures and their subsequent events. These cards provide keywords to spark your imagination and example phrases for their use. Written by novelists and organized by dungeon-masters, the cards are designed for quick on-the-fly use and inherently add randomization. The list of monster parts uniquely depicted include, but are not limited to, Horns, Teeth, Claws, Protrusions, Bodily Forms (Hides, Ears, Eyes, etc.), Tails, Wings, and Tentacles.

Between great heroes and great monsters lies the pinnacle of drama — Combat. The unrelenting tension that comes with knowing blood will be spilled, and life may be lost. Monster Description Cards will guide you while you detail these moments, providing keywords and examples for horns that PIERCE, claws that SLASH, tails that BLUDGEON, and more. Hundreds of new ways to describe monster strikes in these familiar categories: Slashing, Piercing, Bludgeon.

What happens when a monster is cornered, heavily injured, or both? What if the creature is smart enough to be deceitful, spiteful, or vindictive in its last moments? How can you subtly share that your monster is on its last legs, but there is still a worrisome hint of malice in their eyes? These questions are all answered by the LAST STAND section of the cards. Where examples help illustrate the response of creatures facing overwhelming odds and perhaps displaying heroism, sacrifice, or wickedness of their own.

Contents:


90 Physical Cards, all double-sided, effectively 180 Sides with MoDC Content.
18 Blank Template Cards
1 Double-sided Card with Editor Notes on Side a and basic Instructions on Side b.

boardgame.name: The Animals of Camillus
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

Space necromancers must fight against a tide of vermin summoned from beyond space!

This is a 19-page adventure for In Extremis by KeganExe with new enemies, interactive battle sites, and strange spells—everything you'd expect from a LUMEN-fueled adventure.

But wait, there's more! This adventure also includes new rules for...


Cutscenes, small roleplaying moments with direct mechanical consequences (inspired by ship/elevator conversations in games such as Knights of the Old Republic and Mass Effect)
Companions, easy-to-use temporary allies who can lay down covering fire, sacrifice themselves for you...or potentially join your enemies (inspired by quest/scene-based companions in games such as Fallout 3)
These new rules are easily ported to other LUMEN games and provide new options without sacrificing any of the system's breakneck speed.



Also, a new Archetype: The Bees! Bees that are disguised as a necromancer.

boardgame.name: HEARTH: The World Ended But It's Not The End Of The World
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb
The Hearth Calls
The fires of humanity are flickering, Warden, but they are not out. Darkness gathers, but points of light still gutter in that shadowed sky. As you feel the pull of the Hedge, embark once more on perilous missions to save what remains of us, spare a passing thought for those left to pick up the pieces. We are diminished, but we are not destroyed. Our civilizations lie in ruins, but true brave hearts and a stubborn belief that tomorrow may be better remains.

Else what are you fighting for?

Inside you will find:

A new phase of play with Downtime actions.
Rules for setting up the Homeland that your Wardens return to during those moments in-between fighting back the Fey hordes.
Backgrounds to assign to your Wardens that allow them to establish Truths about their world.
A Holdfast that serves as your personal home, and can be upgraded to offer new and interesting bonuses.
Factions that will reward you with Favor for fulfilling Deeds on their behalf, exchangeable for powerful perks.
Devotions in the form of important quests bestowed by the Hedge that act as additional objectives and become Dooms if not completed.
A new Fey Court, and a menagerie of enemies to battle against in the Court of Thorn and Bloom.
Win and lose conditions, as you fight to restore Hope to the remnants of the human race, restoring the Hedge, or else falling to the Fey.


Also Included:

Especially for GMs who use visual aids, we've included a sample map to demonstrate Range Bands in the Map Tools zip file.
A transparent background PNG image file of the Range Bands, to place over the top of any standard battle map. The dimensions are 12x12" at 300dpi, with spacing suitable for any one-inch grid map.

boardgame.name: The Deadly Demon Bay Bash
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb
The Deadly Demon Bay Bash is a modular adventure for Enter the Beast Trinity, the animal folk fighting fantasy game created by The Dice. Enter the Beast Trinity draws a lot of inspiration from fighting games like Street Fighter, Mortal Kombat and Tekken. The Deadly Demon Bay Bash injects some beat-em-up influence into its narrative and focuses in on a specific Reaper domain; Demon Bay, overseen by Boss Beleth.

Tonight, the Beast Warriors of the Worldport will do battle on the streets of Demon Bay. Demon Bay is a place forever drenched in night, where no one can ever sleep. Beleth commands their syndicate of demons to punish the souls of the damned.

Various Beast Trinities will be dropped on the streets of Demon Bay and must make their way to the Poison Pier for a final battle between two teams. But Beleth won’t let these teams through unless they’ve suffered appropriately. Every demon in the Bay has gotten the word: stop a Beast Warrior making it to the Pier and be rewarded.

You’ll need to scrap and claw your way through the mean streets of Demon Bay. Make it to the Pier for the final showdown. Triumph here and earn your freedom. Fail and you’ll continue to toil away in the King of Beast Trinity Championship.

boardgame.name: Realms of Life
boardgame.description:
1-6 players. Immense yourself into one of the 12 characters that make up Team Aura from Digital Reverence! For ages 13+

ENTER THE REALMS OF LIFE... IF YOU DARE!
Do you have the courage?

Someone has released the all powerful, Selina the Red Witch, from her Abyss once more! She has vowed to take over all of the ROLTH Universe! It's up to Team Aura to stop her before the ROLTH Universe as we know it, is ruled by her!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Jarlaxle's Bag of Everything
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Jarlaxle’s Bag of Everything offers a host of new options for Dungeons & Dragons, and our journey through those options is accompanied by the notes of the rogue himself, Jarlaxle.

The dandy Jarlaxle, whose words easily work past his ill reputation, has gathered a deep understanding of others during his, let’s say, illustrious career as a mercenary leader. He was one of a small number of male udadrow who actually had significant power in a Lolth-worshiping city, although he increasingly spent little time in the city itself as he adventured abroad in the Underdark and the Lands Above. Charismatic and cunning, he opens his bag of tricks to others intrigued and like-minded as him.

Written for players and Dungeon Masters alike, this book offers options to enhance characters and campaigns in any D&D world, whether you're adventuring in Forgotten Realms, another official D&D setting, or a world of your own creation.

boardgame.name: Festival of Horrors
boardgame.description:
For 3-6 characters of level 9

From the introduction:

After a particularly grueling battle, the renowned adventurers have received a letter from a pair of brothers named Sohon and Uhon. The two invite the group to partake in a Festival of Brotherhood on the grounds of a sacred temple.

boardgame.name: The Evil on the East River
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Investigators have come to the attention of A’lelia Walker as people of interest. This can be through a personal introduction by a thankful third party, for services rendered, or because Walker has heard of their heroic exploits around New York.

She has invited them to one of her legendary parties at Walker Studios at her grand townhouse on 136th Street.

Walker herself might also be attracted to any Investigators with a high APP. Regardless, by the end of the night, she invites them to accompany her at the next party aboard the steamboat, going down the East River bound for Boston.

boardgame.name: Pinnacle City's Most Wanted
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

A modern city for a modern age, a super city for a super world, home to some of the world’s most beloved heroes, some of its most nefarious villains, and so much more.

Pinnacle City’s Most Wanted is the fi rst sourcebook for Prowlers & Paragons Ultimate Edition, the superhero roleplaying game. Villains are the core of this book. Within these pages you’ll fi nd 48 of the world’s most notorious ne’er do wells, ready to unleash their evil schemes on your game world and wreak havoc at your table. From street-level muscle to cosmic world-killers, Pinnacle City’s Most Wanted has something for your game.

But these aren’t just villains, they’re Pinnacle City’s Most Wanted. In addition to providing you with stats, background information, and unique story ideas, each villain’s entry includes a description of some relevant part of Pinnacle City or the greater Pinnacle City Universe, taking you from the tenements of Bricksville to the bustling heart of Downtown Pinnacle City to the extravagant penthouses of Parkview and beyond, even into the Astral Plane or the Galactic Core! Use these locations as they are or tweak them to fi t your game world.

While villains make up the majority of this book, Pinnacle City’s Most Wanted has more to offer anyone looking to run Prowlers & Paragons Ultimate Edition. This volume also includes an assortment of new Extras, information about secret groups, organizations, and locations in the Pinnacle City Universe, and even describes a number of cosmic entities that may seek to help or hinder the heroes. And for those times when you and your friends want to take a walk on the wild side, Pinnacle City’s Most Wanted even includes rules for playing the bad guys.

Whether your game is going to involve star spanning superheroes, street level vigilantes, or anything in between, Pinnacle City’s Most Wanted has something for you. So let us be the fi rst to say…

boardgame.name: Ectotectonics
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ectotectonics is a 64 page, fully illustrated module for Slipgate Chokepoint, the 1990s first-person shooter hack of the Stay Frosty RPG.

The Rangers must journey through the slipgate to discover why waves of virulent ectoplasm have engulfed a friendly world-base in another dimension - what caused it, who betrayed the facility, and what the base now incubates...

The book contains:
• A full adventure for 3 to 4 Rangers averaging 3rd level!
• 11 hand-drawn arena maps!
• 11 new enemies!
• A top secret experimental and unethical weapon!
• All the ectoplasm you can shake your cestus at!

And a veritable gutload more...

boardgame.name: The Base 16 Enigma Player's Guide (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

So…What Was That, Again?

Sometimes, a little help is needed to survive the challenges of Delta World! This Player’s Guide has been compiled to aid you, the player, in the development of your character to meet the challenges you will face in the three-part adventure campaign, The Base 16 Enigma.

What skill proficiencies are best suited? What information does my character need to succeed? Who was that technological salvage expert?

Answers to these questions, and more, can be found within the pages of this Player’s Guide. Intended to supplement the information found in the Delta World 5E Core Guidebook and Fifth Edition System Reference Document rules for the world’s oldest roleplaying game, it provides an invaluable reference for developing your character and starting out in this campaign.

Come in, explore, and thrive in YOUR Delta World!

boardgame.name: UnFamiliar: Release The Tiny Beasts!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A newly discovered spell allows wizards to liberate their familiars as a reward for all their hard work over the years. These tiny beasts with magical spirits are now able to adventure side-by-side with the other races, equally! This book contains everything you need to play D&D as a former familiar.

All the familiar species are included and balanced for exciting gameplay. Thirteen animal races from the Find Familiar spell are available to you and each has three distinct sub-races. That is nearly 40 animals you can choose from!

Your familiar can choose from 6 classes, each of which leans heavily upon one of the six abilities. Within each class are three sub-classes. These draw from the three aspects of every familiar: their physical form, their arcane past, and their spirit type (Celestial, Fey, or Fiend). The book also contains rule options for those who want to play existing classes.

Wizards rely on their familiars in different ways. UnFamiliar offers 13 distinctly different backgrounds to reflect your past experience. As part of the balancing with the standard races, each background includes a new cantrip you can cast. This cantrip was not only helpful for your previous life as a familiar but will be useful for adventuring, too.

boardgame.name: Traveling Encounters Volume 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fill your world with wondrous encounters that utilize every aspect of the game. This unique resource puts everything your need right before your eyes. Round by round instructions detail combats. Exciting challenges allow your players to use those long-neglected skill proficiencies. Take your storytelling to the next level with thrilling mid-battle twists, alternate encounter objectives, and meaningful resolutions. Unique level-appropriate rewards will boost the morale at your table. This collection includes 47 encounters to keep everyone entertained and engaged as they journey through your campaign world.

boardgame.name: The Art of Seduction
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A guide to the attractivness of your character, and insight into their desires. This also includes DC's for seducing types of NPC's, sexuality, what attracts your character and lines for flirting.

boardgame.name: Mahoning Monstrosity: Monsters Attack Youngstown Ohio, Summer of 1977
boardgame.description:
“You can’t scare me. I was born in Youngstown.”—Anonymous.

It is the summer of 1977 and out of the PCB laden depths of the Mahoning River rises a hideous monster to threaten downtown Youngstown, Ohio. Can you mobilize Steel city’s finest and the Ohio National Guard, all aided or hindered by local personalities, to defend the city and its populace?

Learn and enjoy this whimsical historical gaming salute to Youngstown as it battles a mythical monster during the summer before the real ones came to the fore that fateful October.

—description from the designer

Each copy of Mahoning Monstrosity is composed of the following:

One 11 by 17 inch map

One sheet of 81 unmounted, double sided counters

12 pages of rules and charts

Players will also need a six sided die, some scrap paper and a pen or pencil to play the game.

listing.notes:
For sale is a brand new copy of Mahoning Monstrosity. Mounted counters can be had for an additional $8.00.
A boxed version of the game, that has the game pieces mounted, cut out and sorted into small zip lock bags is also available for $30.00 plus shipping. All proceeds from the sales of the boxed edition go to support the Butler Institute of American Art. "The Butler" is prominently featured on the game map and is one of the places you can defend against the monster's rampages. Please indicate you would like the boxed edition and to support the Butler Institute of American Art when you place your order.
Paypal gladly accepted. Check or money order only from domestic USA customer.

boardgame.name: Gaia Project: GeekyGameyGadgets Organizer
boardgame.description:
Laser cut organizer for your copy of Gaia Project the board game.

This custom insert holds all the pieces for the your Gaia Project board game. Includes custom engravings in the trays. Compatible with both plain cards and sleeved cards (60mm x 90mm or smaller). Allows game to be stored however you want: horizontally or vertically.

Arrives with all pieces punched out and ready for assembly. Does not include the game itself. Includes instructions and plenty of email support so you won't worry about encountering any issues.

listing.notes:
Laser cut insert for your copy of Gaia Project. Does not include the game itself.
This custom insert holds all the pieces for the your Gaia Project board game. Includes custom engravings in the trays. Compatible with both plain cards and sleeved cards (60mm x 90mm or smaller). Allows for vertical or horizontal storage.
Arrives ready for assembly. Includes instructions and plenty of email support so you won't worry about encountering any issues.
Shipping within the USA is $9.
[ImageID=5889998 medium]The engraved trays make it easy to tell which pieces go where. [ImageID=5889999 medium] [ImageID=5890002 medium]Trays nest together to fit perfectly for storage [ImageID=5890004 medium] [ImageID=5890005 medium]Boards can be placed above or beneath the trays.

boardgame.name: Triviavore
boardgame.description:
The Ultimate Trivia Boardgame! Triviavore highlights the brilliant absurdity of mother nature. But it also employs Darwinian survival strategies. You don’t need to know a thing about aardvarks to become an apex hunter.

Unlike some trivia games, this one offers you closed choices (“A, B, or C?”). So if a question stumps the central organ in your nervous system, you can frequently survive on hunches, or guessing.

If you think trivia questions are about as friendly as rattlesnakes, then go light on the gnarly questions. Find “camouflage and dodge” or “ink and stink” cards to build your defenses. Or land on a human to damage someone else’s habitat (or repair your own).

Triviavore takes two or three minutes to set up and 15-20 minutes to play. It is printed entirely in the USA on sustainably harvested paper certified by the Forest Stewardship Council. It has no plastic parts, and is not even shrink-wrapped. The cards celebrate nature and are colorful and attractive.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Forest of Lost Children
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Forest of Lost Children presents a series of unique puzzles and combat encounters that can be both whimsical and deadly. In most cases, there is more than one way to complete each encounter and while violence is always an option, it isn't always the best option.

boardgame.name: The Beast of Bridgedunon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The town of Bridgedunon and the fortress from which it takes its name have stood guard for hundreds of years. Over the years, it has held against barbarians and fey armies, standing the tests of time. But now, in an era of peace, it faces a more subtle and insidious attack.
Farmers have reported the loss of sheep and goats, hunters have found the mutilated bodies of deer and elk in the woods, and strange tracks have been found, made by some massive and unknown beast. The townspeople have begun to fear for their lives, worried that the creature may soon start to crave human flesh.

Strangely, the local lord refuses to take action. It is up to the adventurers to solve the mystery. They must locate the beast and remove the threat it poses to the town.
Like our previous adventure, The Forest of Lost Children, this tale takes the players into a dark fairy tale reminiscent of the original Grimm stories. Everyone has their own secrets, and the danger to the town may not be quite what it seems.

User summary:

Includes 11" x 17" folded map poster.

boardgame.name: Encounters - Volume III: Dark Depths of The Underearth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the darkness beware of the lights.

Salamanders preparing an ambush for unsuspecting travelers. Drow outpost attacked by monsters. An aboleth plotting in the lake deep underground. The creatures of the Underearth lurk in the corridors to drag heroes into the darkness.

This encounter pack contains 10 carefully designed encounters, with monster tactics, leads, hooks, and new monsters and items to spice up your game. Easy to use and drop into any adventure–to fill up blanks on the map, make a long journey more interesting or kickstart another adventure. The dark corridors of the Underearth await!

boardgame.name: Encounters - Volume IV: In the Ruins of The Underearth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ancient Ruins Hide Deadly Secrets.

Aranea waiting to ambush unwary travelers. Rapp’akh mage asking for help with his golem. Ghost warriors guarding the ancient bridge. Efreeti waiting in an ancient forge. The ruins of the Underearth are a dangerous place, hiding foes ready to bring the heroes down.

This encounter pack contains 10 carefully designed underground themed encounters for both the 5th edition and 3.5 edition of the world's most popular roleplaying games, with monster tactics, leads, hooks, and new monsters and items to spice up your game. Easy to use and drop into any adventure–to fill up blanks on the map, make a long journey more interesting or kickstart another adventure.

boardgame.name: Golden Liqueur
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Cries for help echo from down the road. The trees blocking your view, you sprint around a bend in the path. You happen upon what looks to be a dragonborn, being beaten by several humanoids in masks. At the sight of you, they rip the dragonborn’s belongings from them and proceed to run into the tree line. What do you do?

boardgame.name: Temple of the Four Elements
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Temple of the Four Elements is a dungeon meant for a party of level 5-7 adventurers. The temple itself is a stronghold composed of 4 separate towers, sealed away within a pocket dimension. Its creator, Cassidy Van Hellker was a mage who wanted to better research the four fundamental elements to unlock their mystical secrets. In doing so she separated the four elements into four towers, each tower then took on the properties of the element stored within them.

boardgame.name: The Final Fantasy Compendium
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The worlds and characters of Final Fantasy awe and inspire us. Don't let your dreams be dreams. Bring your own fantasy to life with this supplement.

Along with the Player's Handbook and other official rule books, sing your own song in the key of Final Fantasy.

boardgame.name: Collections from the Planes
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In my travels, I have amassed quite the collection, a veritable dragon's horde of magic miscellany. But my coffers now overflow with trinkets, and I bore of many of them. Rarely do I part with anything for free, but perhaps it is time to clean the shelves, and make room for my new relics.

boardgame.name: Formula OviNE
boardgame.description:
A sheep racing game where 3-6 players blind bid matchsticks and those who don't bid the same as another player(s) get to move; the aim being to race your sheep around 'the Barn' and back over the finish line before the other players.

Each sheep comes with a 'driver' with a special power and a terrible sheep pun for a name eg. Jenson Mutton, A Lamb Prost etc.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mutants in the Now - Playtest Version
boardgame.description: Playtest Version released to Backers

boardgame.name: 永い後日談のネクロニカ Nechronica -The Long Long Sequel- Unofficial
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A world in which humanity has met its end.
A world in which everyone has died.
A world in which nothing more can die.
In which naught stirs but walking corpses.
...
Nechronica -The Long Long Sequel- is a tabletop (pencil-and-paper, face-to-face, et al.) RPG published by Incog Labs/Tsugihagi Honbo/Patch Works and designed by Ryo Kamiya
...
Unofficial Fan Translation, v1⋅0⋅0 (OCT/31/2019)
This book contains rules from the main book, the supplements Garden of Stories, The Great Drama and Dance of Distortion, and official Errata.

boardgame.name: Tate no Yuusha no Nariagari ~ The Rising of the Shield Hero
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Four Legendary Heroes are a group of ordinary men from modern-day Japan summoned to the kingdom of Melromarc to become its saviors. Melromarc is a country plagued by the Waves of Catastrophe that have repeatedly ravaged the land and brought disaster to its citizens for centuries. The four heroes are respectively bestowed a sword, spear, bow, and shield to vanquish these Waves. Naofumi Iwatani, an otaku, becomes cursed with the fate of being the "Shield Hero." Armed with only a measly shield, Naofumi is belittled and ridiculed by his fellow heroes and the kingdom's people due to his weak offensive capabilities and lackluster personality.

boardgame.name: Overland Travel
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This document is a collection of simple overland travel rules intended for players not used to campaigns that focus on such things.

boardgame.name: Parachutes: Play in the Dark Card Game
boardgame.description:
1-6 players must construct a collective landing strip of cards with the aim of creating 'chute' patterns. However, you play in the dark! You must coordinate your effort using the glow in the dark dots on each of the cards corners. The winner is the player with the most 'chute' patterns - parachutes, almostchutes, semichutes - when the lights go on.

Players each receive a deck of cards that they play in turn by adding one card each to the centre of the table. Once all players have placed their cards the lights go on and scores are counted. Multiple rounds can be played and variant rules, such as speed play, can be introduced.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Conspiracy: Abyss Universe – Score Pad
boardgame.description: A score pad that you can purchase extra from Bombyx. They also have a link on their shop that will let you download the files for free.

boardgame.name: Hardwar
boardgame.description:
The turn of the twenty-second century was a time of great progression of the human race, space exploration, scientific and technological advancements. It was also the time of neo-colonialism, and a new order emerging from the pyres of the old world. It was a time of a new breed of war – the Hardwar.

Hardwar tries to recreate possible future ground battlefield conditions, providing straightforward rules allowing for a fast-paced tactical experience in a relatively hard science fiction setting. Hardwar takes into account not only classic armoured warfare, enriched with fictional contraptions like mechs, spaceships, or exotic weapons, but also futuristic predictions of combat evolution – the importance of cybernetic warfare, decline in numbers of human soldiers replaced with AI algorithms, a rise of sentient combat swarms and electronic fog of war, or experimental development of new exotic weapons, to name a few. This approach, combined with simple and flexible rules should provide new and exciting tactical opportunities for tabletop commanders.

Aside from this rulebook, all that is needed for a game is a couple of miniatures, representing your battle group, a handful of twelve-sided dice and another one of small tokens or coins, measuring tape, a table, a couple of terrain pieces and, most importantly, an opponent.

Becoming a force commander in Hardwar world is not a difficult task. You can start your own private security company, lease a few war machines and go out there, looking for contracts from the big fish. You can be a corporate commander, working for one of the major forces of your world, executing the will of shareholders by all means necessary. You can become the charismatic leader of revolutionary forces, fighting against corporate overlords. You can be a small-time dictator in an area of wastelands forgotten by transnationals, or a noble self-appointed marshal, trying to protect helpless civilians from raiders. You can be a pirate, you can be a bounty hunter, you can be a mercenary. All you need is to get your hands on some equipment, find a few reliable hardware operators and convince someone with money to let you solve their problem. If you are good enough, you can get additional contracts with media, to make a reality holo-show about your group, you can get sponsors from the arms industry, agents and lawyers to negotiate your contracts, and that penthouse mansion in the orbital city you have always dreamt of.

Your force will face other security consultants, fighting for other employers. Sometimes you will take part in internal power struggles, sometimes you will perform a hostile takeover, sometimes you will sabotage a competitive facility, sometimes you will have to deal with locals unwilling to relocate from your employer’s property, sometimes you will go on bandit hunt, you will extinguish, or incite revolution… it will not always be pretty, but surely will be profitable.

–description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Pokémon in 5th Edition
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

How to run your own Pokémon role-playing game using existing 5E rules.

Including Generations I - VII

boardgame.name: A /tg/ Anon's Academic View on Harems
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the past years, exported in huge part by anime and manga, the harem has re-entered the western psyche and become a more mainstream idea among fantasy game players and authors. Harems can be an attractive option for both sex appeal and character drama as they introduce the classic dilemma of loving multiple women whilst still allowing a satisfying ending for all characters involved.

Harems often fall into the world of magical realm and wish fulfillment, however. There are a number of pitfalls that they can and often do fall into when attempting to include such an element within their narrative. There are a number of core issues that must be addressed in order to avoid the common pitfalls.

boardgame.name: The Goblin's Den
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your village is out of food! Your only hope is to bring back gold from an old goblin-infested ruin.

And it is YOU who has volunteered for this perilous mission.

boardgame.name: Rescue Mission in the Frozen Forest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A caravan was attacked by brigands while crossing the forest. The scholar on board has information that could be crucial for the survival of the kingdom. A rescue mission must be launched!

And it is YOU who has volunteered for this perilous mission.

boardgame.name: The Tomb of the Forgotten Priest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

To save your village you desperately need money. So when a notorious grave robber offers you to go and loot the tomb of a thousand-year-old priest who has devoted his entire life to the worship of an ancient monstrosity, you have no choice but to accept!

boardgame.name: The Wandering Knight
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Wandering Knight is an ultra-light rule system solo rpg.
...
Focus on a single character

You tell the story of a single hero.

Recruit allies to become stronger

Turn your loser into a hero! Also tell the psychology of the character. The Knight Errant has a weakness at the beginning of the adventure. He must find a way to overcome this weakness to become a hero.

boardgame.name: The Thinking Thinker
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Thinking Thinker is a new way to live out your destitute existence within the Mork Borg universe, sure, you're very intelligent and witty, but what use is that when everything is miserable and horrible? Discover your origins on how you became so very smart!

boardgame.name: Curse of the Obsidian Knight
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Deep within the 4th Hell in the shadow of towering creatures lumbering about with impossibly long limbs, some of them miles long, sits a Keep made of rough-hewn Obsidian. Accessible only with the singular matching key, this fortress of fear is home to a most conniving and wicked knight, a singular force of twisted plotting and evil.

What treasure awaits? What will you do for adventure and glory?

Curse of the Obsidian Knight is a small, OSR-style adventure. The stats are for Basic Fantasy Roleplaying Game, but should be easily adaptable to just about any RPG of your choice.

boardgame.name: The Hills Have Legs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Hills Have Legs is a classic dungeon crawl against the nastiest group of goblins you’ve ever met. Trust us when we say, this particular clan are going to haunt your player’s nightmares.

listing.notes: Buyer pays $6 for shipping.

boardgame.name: Regime Rumble: Core Game
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the year 4057

The world is overpopulated and cloning has been banned from day-to-day use. The De'Graw corporation has managed to obtain an entertainment license under global code 456-8. This allows the use of cloning to subdue mass unrest. The corporation has begun a televised sensation, Regime Rumble! Ever wonder who was the best in politics, science, or pop culture? What would happen when these personalities from around the world meet to duke it out? Well now you can find out every Saturday morning! Watch as famous personalities from around the world are defeated and cloned again and returned to the arena. Unfortunately, the more frequently they are cloned the more the copies begin to degrade.

Smash your friends in a fast paced game of futuristic clone combat. The RR core box has everything you need to get started and play! (Just add a LOT of dice)

Regime Rumble consists of 1-2 miniatures per side (when playing with 4 players) and is played on a 2'×2' area. Gameplay and combat is based on a simple D6 dice pool mechanic that is fast to learn and fun to play.

Players will set about choosing their regimes from available clones and using their cards to perform various special actions and abilities. At the heart of RR is a system of conspiracy cards that allow players to work together to bluff and trick their opponents, to the victor goes the crown!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: A Game of Thrones: B'Twixt
Gra o Tron: Sojusze
Hra o trůny: Spiknutí
Juego de Tronos: Tierra de Nadie
Il Trono di Spade: Terre di Nessuno
boardgame.description:
Manipulate the flow of politics in King’s Landing in this fast-paced card game for 3 to 6 players, and lead your House as one of nine iconic characters from the Song of Ice and Fire series. Use your influence to attract new allies and carefully navigate the other players’ allegiances as you strive to have the most powerful small council in Westeros. Just be wary of your own alliances—you never know when someone will stab you in the back!

—description from publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire

Brand new copy of the game, in shrink wrap.
Shipping to EU would be 15 euro and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere – please ask!
